content.text: A student times single oscillations with a stopwatch. In 10 separate measurements, the stopwatch readings were:
What is the best value obtainable from these readings for the time of one oscillation? Explain how you arrive at your answer
best value =
explanation
Describe how, using the same stopwatch, the student can find the period of oscillation more accurately
[Total: 5]
The period of the vertical oscillations of a mass hanging from a spring is known constant
from A to B,
from B to C,
from C to D
Describe her motion
her average speed from A to D,
average speed = .........
her maximum speed
maximum speed = .........
Calculate
A girl rides her bicycle along a straight level road. Fig. 2.1 shows a graph of her speed against time
State an example of the conversion of chemical energy to another form of energy
example

The pump converts electrical energy to kinetic energy of water with an efficiency of \(35\%\)
Calculate the kinetic energy of the water delivered by the pump in 1 second
kinetic energy = .........
The pump propels \(0.00014 \text{m}^3\) of water per second. This water rises vertically as a jet. The density of water is \(1000 \text{kg} / \text{m}^3\)
Calculate
1. the mass of water propelled by the pump in 1 second,
the maximum height of the jet of water
maximum height = .........
The electrical output of a solar panel powers a pump. The pump operates a water fountain. The output of the solar panel is 17 V and the current supplied to the pump is 0.27 A
The force \(F_{1}\) is \(90 \text{N}\). Calculate the pressure exerted on the oil by piston X
pressure = .........
The pressure on piston Y is the same as the pressure applied by piston X. Explain why the force \(F_{2}\) is greater than the force \(F_{1}\)
Piston Y moves a smaller distance than piston X. Explain why
Suggest why the braking system does not work properly if the oil contains bubbles of air
[Total: 7]
Fig. 4.1 represents part of the hydraulic braking system of a car

The force \(F_{1}\) of the driver's foot on the brake pedal moves piston X. The space between pistons X and Y is filled with oil which cannot be compressed. The force \(F_{2}\) exerted by the oil moves piston Y. This force is applied to the brake mechanism in the wheels of the car
The area of cross-section of piston X is \(4.8 \text{cm}^2\)
an example of a change of state resulting from the removal of thermal energy from a quantity of material,
the effect of this change of state on the temperature of the material
Suggest
Define the thermal capacity of a body
Calculate the thermal energy lost by the water in cooling to \(0^\circ \text{C}\)
State the thermal energy gained by the ice in melting
Calculate the mass of ice added

A polystyrene cup holds \(250 \text{g}\) of water at \(20^\circ \text{C}\). In order to cool the water to make a cold drink, small pieces of ice at \(0^\circ \text{C}\) are added until the water reaches \(0^\circ \text{C}\) and no unmelted ice is present
[specific heat capacity of water \(= 4.2 \text{J} / (\text{g} \circ \text{C})\), specific latent heat of fusion of ice \(= 330 \text{J} / \text{g}]\)
Assume no thermal energy is lost or gained by the cup
the water level initially falls,
the water level then rises,
the rise is greater than the fall
Suggest why
Suggest a change to the apparatus that would make the fall and rise of the water level greater

When the flask is placed in hot water, the water level initially falls a little below X, and then rises some way above X

The waves approaching the barrier in Fig. 7.1 have a wavelength of \(1.4 \text{cm}\) and travel at a speed of \(12 \text{cm/s}\)

frequency = .........

In Fig. 8.1, S is a metal sphere standing on an insulating base. R is a negatively charged rod placed close to S
the average current between the thunderclouds and the ground,
average current = .........
the energy transferred in each stroke of lightning

During a thunderstorm, the potential difference between thunderclouds and the ground builds up to \(1.5 \times 10^6 \text{V.}\) In each stroke of lightning, \(30 \text{C}\) of charge passes between the thunderclouds and the ground. Lightning strokes to the ground occur, on average, at 2 minute intervals
Calculate
State the relationship between
the potential difference between X and Y,
the current \(I_{3}\) ,
current = .........
the resistance of R
resistance = .........

Calculate

gap A
gap B
